description.narrative: The objectives of the Local Authorities Development Program Project for Senegal are to: (a) strengthen the capacity of urban municipalities to improve resource mobilization, and municipal and urban management; and (b) increase access to and quality of public infrastructure and services in urban areas. Under this level two restructuring, the closing date of the project is to be extended from September 30, 2103 to December 16, 2013. This extension will allow time for the project to address the impacts of poor rainwater drainage system in the neighborhood Camille Basse in Rufisque resulting from the construction of a road financed under the project. As the contract related to the road construction is still under implementation, it was recommended to amend the ongoing contract to include actions to mitigate the risk of further flooding.

condition.narrative: Respect of eligibility criteria for Municipalities for Part B
Respect of eligibility of PIP for Part B
Respect of terms and conditions for the carrying out of the municipal and inter-communal investment sub-projects.
The Recipient shall employ a CMA, under TORs, and with staffing and resources to be responsible for implementation of Part B.
The Recipient shall maintain the MDA as the Project Implementing Entity, with staffing, mandate and resources to be responsibleforoverall project coordination and implementation.
The Recipient shall prepare a mid-term report incorporating (a) progress achieved in carrying out the project; (b) review of thestrategic vision for MDA; and (c) an assessment of the TA program to CA

title.narrative: Mobilization of non-tax revenues directly by the Municipalities (percentage)

baseline.value: (CFAF8.3 billion, 2005 actual revenues, for the five urban municipalities of the Greater Dakar Area and the 12 regional capitals)

title.narrative: Number of persons directly benefiting from at least one subproject
Quarterly progress reports produced within a month after the period
Number of municipalities using maintenance funds for infrastructure
Share of sub-projects implemented within timeframe
Share of facilities built/rehabilitated effectively in use within 6 months of completion
Average number of days for payment of invoices to contractors and consultants
Share of labor costs>20% for municipal PIPs (at each PIP level)
Part allocated annually through the local authorities' budget to finance infrastructure and maintenance (percentage)
Number of municipal budgets approved by the Prefect after generation by the municipalities before April 15 of each year (percentage)
Number of provisional budget reports prepared by the Treasury before March 31 of each year.
Level of resource mobilization (percentage of revenue increase in urban municipalities' account).

baseline.value: CFAF35.5 billion (2005 actual revenues, for the five urban municipalities of the Greater Dakar Area and the 12 regional capitals)

title.narrative: Percentage of repayments of municipal loans and contributions
